answers.answer: It's important to have a full pituitary evaluation -- this includes tsh, t4, t3, acth, cortisol, prolactin, fsh, lh, estradiol (likely normal with menstrual periods) and possibly growth hormone.  Also check sodium level - but it doesn't sound like you have diabetes insipidus (these patients have severe thirst and inc'd urination).  The TSH alone of 6 may be a primary thyroid problem OR a pituitary problem, but more likely primary thyroid.  Also note any visual changes or headaches -- the labs will be the key to any endo eval....good luck.
